body:
As per title.

I realized that the TNT maps aren't really gonna fit in with the normal maps. We can make a server exclusive to TNT. 
(TNT Large) Large scale TNT maps

(TNT medium) Medium scale TNT maps

Server listings:
  • Annihilation (TNT Large)
  • Ruins (TNT Medium)
  • Carnage (TNT Large)
  • Havoc (TNT Medium)
  • Subjugation (TNT Medium)
  • Extinction (TNT Large)
  • TNT-Turtles (TNT Medium and Large)
  • (Suggest more...) 
Requesting special features:
  • Crazy Sapper: A special permission to use TNT and redstone; Is granted automatically but can be revoked by a moderator or Jr.Mod. 
  • Battle Master: Special permission to use dispensers. Can be revoked. Is granted after 25 kills with TNT.
  • War Martial: All Redstone and TNT usage (Redstone repeaters, comparators, wooden buttons and plates, redstone blocks, etc.). Can be revoked. Is granted by getting 5 objectives and 50 TNT kills.
Rules: 
  • No purposeful spawnkilling. Punishable by a 3 warn then a 1 month temp ban. Second offenders will be PBed.
  • No purposeful greifing. Punishable by an automatic perma ban.
  • No hogging the TNT supplies or stealing. Punishable by a kick.
  • Do not killfarm, if the enemy is beaten to submission with TNT cannons then rush the objective. Punishable by 3 warns then a kick. 
  • Do not accuse anyone of greifing if they're using TNT in a remote area to make the space under an objective deep or open. Punishable by 3 warns then a kick.
  • Any other Avicus rules apply here too!
Remember, you came to this server to have fun not be kill joy.

replies.body:
I'm gonna have to take his side on this one....
It's true. The average avicus randy doesn't know how to even build a whiskey or even a potato. The only "cannon" they know is "blow up my teammate cannon." I got tked many times in the existing tnt map, and what Jozz said is right. Even in OCN it took at least a year for people to start using tnt cannons heavily in nostalgia. At first it's total chaos. The mods have to enforce the rules severely until people start adapting to tnt.

replies.body:
Wow, when i made this thread I never wanted it to be a competition... but then a wild gibbodman came along... and turned this thread from a peaceful idea to a full blown competition and argument. 

Then when I call him out on instigating a flame war (Which he did) then I'm later threatened by a Sr.Mod. Wow. Seriously, point your threatening ban hammer at the person who started all this. 

Anyway, these maps are for Nebula TNT maps. TNT Run would be in Avicade and it isnt really original.

replies.body: Imho, I agree with what Gibbo said. Even though some players may know how to use TNT and make cannons, the majority probably don't. I didn't really see anything pessimistic about his post, he was just giving his honest opinion, which I respect. Sure, he can be a tad rude with how he expresses his opinions, but it doesn't mean we should shoot down everything he says. (Hopefully this doesn't cause another argument, I just wanted to give my 2 cents).

replies.body:
I know that someone asked that it's impossible to detect which team places tnt, to prevent teamgriefing, yet OCN has these shears that stop tnt that came from your team. How is this possible?

On-Topic: I haven't even tried OCN medium level, but trying some tnt by myself is pretty fun. +1 if there is some kind of good griefing protection, like active avicus members.

It is not impossible to detect.
You can detect who placed the TNT, then check what team that player is in.
